name: COMMONWEALTH of Pennsylvania, Petitioner v. Melanie JAROMA, Respondent

pin_cites.parenthetical: holding that a motion to dismiss made pursuant to Pa.R.Crim.P. 600 must be made in writing, and a copy of such motion must be served on the Commonwealth's attorney
holding that a motion to dismiss made pursuant to Pa.R.Crim.P. 600 must be made in writing, and a copy of such motion must be served on the Commonwealth's attorney

parties: COMMONWEALTH of Pennsylvania, Petitioner v. Melanie JAROMA, Respondent.

opinions.text:
ORDER
PER CURIAM.
AND NOW, this 7th day of October, 2013, the Petition for Allowance of Appeal is GRANTED, the Order of the Superior Court is VACATED, and the matter is REMANDED to the Superior Court for consideration of Commonwealth v. Brock, 619 Pa. 278, 61 A.3d 1015 (2013) (holding that a motion to dismiss made pursuant to Pa.R.Crim.P. 600 must be made in writing, and a copy of such motion must be served on the Commonwealth’s attorney).
opinions.author: PER CURIAM.

casebody.head_matter:
77 A.3d 633
COMMONWEALTH of Pennsylvania, Petitioner v. Melanie JAROMA, Respondent.
Supreme Court of Pennsylvania.
Oct. 7, 2013.
